doc.title: Using TeXML in Python
doc.p: The module Texml.process converts a TeXML file to a TeX file.

ol.li: Set up the input and output streams
Use a try-except block around the call to process

sect.title: Parameters for the function process

dl.dd: An input TeXML document as a file object or the path to a file. Mandatory.
An output TeX document as a file object. Mandatory.
Recommended width to split long lines on smaller ones. Optional, default is 62.
Output encoding. Should be known to the Python codecs. Optional, default is ascii.
Use only ASCII symbols for output. Non-ASCII bytes are escaped using the ^^XX form, where XX is a hexadecimal code of the character. Optional, default is 0 (False, do not encode as ASCII).
ConTeXt is an alternative to LaTeX. In ConTeXt mode, TeXML translation is slightly different. Set to 1 (True) to activate this mode. Optional, default is 0 (False, LaTeX mode).

sect.p: If the input file doesn't conform to the TeXML specification, then the exception TeXML.handler.InvalidXmlException is raised. If the input parameters are invalid, then the exception ValueError is raised. Expect that the underlying libraries might also raise exceptions, such as xml.sax.SAXException.
